dlgLine.text: I'm calling this meeting because me and many others here disapprove of Lloyd's special treatement. I think it's only fair that Lloyd do his fair share around here, just like everyone else.
Sure, why don't we listen to the guy that was willing to risk his life halfway around the world for less than what a dog groomer makes.

As I have told you all in the past, I have skills that are in high demand. I've always sold my expertise to the highest bidder - those rates are non-negotiable, even if the world ends. In fact, I'd say my rates are pretty much at a premium now.
We are debating Lloyd's special treatment. Should he continue to be held to different standards than our other members?
I don't much care for Mr. McCroskey, and he's probably just fine with that. Now, I appreciate his abilities and feel like we are at an advantage having a pilot among our ranks.
However, I feel the only fair way to deal with this is for him to pull his weight around here, same as anyone. He eats our food, lives under our guard, uses our equipment - he works for it.
<To you> Now, maybe you can convince me otherwise. But you know how I feel about this issue.
My vote is to strip him of his special status and get him working same as any of us.

When I was in the military, nobody liked mercs. If a guy's only motivation was money, there was no longer any moral oversight for what they would do - paychecks before conscience. You can't trust anyone who operates like that.

Because of people like him, infected patients escaped quarantines, they spread this disease, and here we are. I don't care if he's an ex-spook, a drug mule, or a standard gun-for-hire, but he is not one of us.
I refuse to pay for his loyalty - either he works or he goes.
<To you> Unless you have a damn good reason, I can't support you on this.
I don't know why anyone would vote for anything else.
<Claps> Bravo. That was a real Mr. Smith Goes to Washington moment, Paul. Just like all those rousing speeches the politicians made before getting all your buddies getting killed in Iraq.
So... here's how it's going to go down here - nothing's going to change. And if it does, then perhaps you should start knocking on doors and asking if they have any pilots.
<To you> We had a deal.
Not having a pilot in these uncertain times - can you risk that? Because I'm going to bet that you can't.
I agree with Lloyd - we do need a pilot.
And, to keep him extra safe, I say we throw his ass in a prison cell and keep him around until we need his ass to fly a damn plane. How's that?
And don't you worry, Lloyd - you'll have the finest cell in the place. I personally promise to hose you down once a week.
No cell you could construct here would hold me.
Alright, then I say we throw him out!
<To you> Unless you got other plans. I'm good with those too.
He's out.
I do agree that having a pilot here is a good thing. Although, I also think it's only fair that he work the same as anyone here.
Irony, ladies and gentleman.
<To you> I'm likely to support anything you propse - I've been happy with your past decisions, for the most part.
I'm not even sure the majority of the people here know Mr. McCroskey gets preferential treatment. If they did, I'm pretty sure they'd be outraged, so best to change that now.
I'm going to suggest an even bolder decision - let's get rid of him altogether!
I don't trust him to fly us out - in fact, I'd expect it's just a matter of time before he sells us out to Coyotes or some other group out there for thirty pieces of silver.
It's too bad your husband isn't here - I would have loved to meet the man that married you. I'm sure you still have his balls in your purse somewhere.
<To you> You know, I'll support you if you disagree out of respect, but I really hope you'll get rid of him.
Get rid of him!
<To you> So... how do you want to go forward with Lloyd?

dlgAnsw.text: Lloyd's skills are too valuable to risk. He's off-duty unless I say so.
Lloyd will work and be treated the same as everyone here.
We don't need to waste resources on him anymore. We're removing Lloyd from the shelter.
As leaders, we should all ration our food for a week as a display of our commitment to the people here to solve this.
We ate yesterday, so today we go without. We will resume normal rations tomorrow.
We have too many mouths to feed. Leave it to me... I'll take care of our problem the more direct way.

dlgLine.text: Lloyd's status will remain unchanged. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to make Lloyd available full-time to work on any task assigned to him. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to remove Lloyd from the shelter. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to immediately serve items that many here wouldn't normally eat to boost the immediate supply of food in the shelter. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to cut food to the whole shelter for today in order to preserve more food for the future. It will be crucial that we find more food today. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: ...I'm not sure I agree with the implication of that decision. Are you sure that's how you want to proceed?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: Lloyd's status here will remain unchanged.
I'd rather he pitched in, but if you think it's best not to risk our only pilot's life, I guess we can make an exception.
You know, if it were anyone else, then maybe, but McCroskey has a really special gift for working my last damn nerve. For the record - I'm not okay with this.
...You're the boss here. I'll accept this decision, but only because you've been fair in the past.

I don't know what he has on you to get this kind of benefit, but you're making a mistake listening to him. People aren't going to be happy to know that their lives are on the line to keep that prick comfortable.
Don't worry, big boy - I'll save a cold one for you.
A wise decision. You all might not know it yet, but someday you're going to be very thankful that <charname> made the right call.
A wise decision. You all might not know it yet, but someday you're going to be very thankful that <charname> made the right call.
Okay... if you say so.
So we're just keep looking the other way while flyboy does whatever the hell he wants? Bullshit.
It's not going to be a popular decision, but I suppose you have your reasons.
That's disappointing... I don't know if I can defend this decision.
If you want to keep that man around, well, I'll back you - but this might be the last time I can stick up for bad policy.
He should be out of here. If he's so skilled, he should have no problem finding another group of suckers to take him in.
VOID.
I don't know if I would have thought of it, but it sets a good example and it should put a lot of people at ease about our intentions. I can get behind this.
I don't know if I would have thought of it, but it sets a good example and it should put a lot of people at ease about our intentions. I can get behind this.
I think it's a difficult sacrifice that we can all make. Overall, it's a pretty shrewd move that should boost everyone's faith in our ability to get them through this.
I think it's a difficult sacrifice that we can all make. Overall, it's a pretty shrewd move that should boost everyone's faith in our ability to get them through this.
I'm not really on board with this... but I'll cash in one of my favors to you and go along with it.
That couldn't be farther from what I want. You want me to give up food for these people? I don't even know half their names.
Eat less? You know, I'll do it because I guess sometimes you don't make me regret coming here, but don't make this a regular thing.
You want ME to eat less?! What the hell kind of logic is that? We're in charge - if anything, it should be the other way around.
...I like it. I think it says a lot about all our character and I'm sure that the people here will appreciate it, and maybe even willingly cooperate with us through any further hardships.
...I like it. I think it says a lot about all our character and I'm sure that the people here will appreciate it, and maybe even willingly cooperate with us through any further hardships.
I disagree, but... maybe you'll prove me wrong, I don't know.
It's a strong move... I like it. It sends the right message and buys good will in a way that nothing else will. Sure, we'll have to tighten our belts, but everyone will see us do it.
Lloyd will be put on the job board, same as anyone else, starting immediately.
About damn time.
About damn time.
Good. I'm really glad you came through on this one.
Good. I'm really glad you came through on this one.
I told you my terms when I agreed to come with you. If you're going to break your word, then you leave me no choice but to consider other options.
I told you my terms when I agreed to come with you. If you're going to break your word, then you leave me no choice but to consider other options.
If that's what you want... For now, I'll support you.
So, we still have to put up with him? I'd almost rather he was here, because I sure as shit don't trust him with my life.
It's only right.
It's only right.
If you really need him here, then I suppose I can support this.
I don't know how much clearer I can make this - I don't want him here.
The decision is to remove Lloyd from the shelter immediately.
I still think we need a pilot, but I suppose when it comes down to it, we can't trust him.
So, the only person we have that's qualified to fly a plane, and we're just going to get rid of him? What the hell kind of logic is that?
It's not necessary, but I'll enforce this if you want.
As much as I don't like him, I don't think anyone deserves to be on their own outside the gate.

When all of you are sitting in a cockpit one day, desperately trying to flee for your lives, I want you to think of me when you can't even find the engine switch. I'll be fine... I've been in worse situations.

When all of you are sitting in a cockpit one day, desperately trying to flee for your lives, I want you to think of me when you can't even find the engine switch. I'll be fine... I've been in worse situations.
So long, Lloyd. Can't say I'll miss you. It's funny, because I'll be shooting at you from the roof.
So long, Lloyd. Can't say I'll miss you. It's funny, because I'll be shooting at you from the roof.
I suppose that's one way of dealing with him. If you believe it's for the best, I'll support you.
His crime was sloth. I don't think death is a suitable penalty.
Perfect. This is one more step on the path to making this place a viable community.
Perfect. This is one more step on the path to making this place a viable community.
The decision is to cut all food today, conserve resources for the future, and hopefully secure more food immediately.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
I'm really not happy about this, but I'll back you up because I have confidence you won't make this a weekly event.
No food today? And what happens if we're attacked or driven out of here? We'll be dead on our feet. <Shakes his head> You people...
Do I look like I diet? Still, I guess you've stuck your neck out for me before, so I can deal with it.
So let me get this straight - I don't eat and you'll probably make me do the heavy lifting out there? Well, why didn't you say we were having shit sandwiches for dinner?
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
The decision is to... find a way to reduce the population here at the shelter through whatever means necessary.
I... I really hope that you mean you're going to find a volunteer.
What the hell is this - the damn mafia? I swear on my goddamn life that if I hear you took someone behind a shed and put a bullet in them about this, I'm taking you down!
I have to believe you've got a better plan than just fragging the last person to piss you off. Right?
If you're going to turn this into a dictatorship, you better believe I will work with everyone else to depose you.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
If you're going to rule by fear, I say you have to draw a line somewhere, but on the other hand I'm fairly sure you won't pick me, so I'm willing to let it slide.
That sounds like something Marshall would do... And I'm sure as hell not going to stay if I have to live in fear of being on your shit list.
I hope this is just a misunderstanding... Based on our previous actions, I have to believe you're going to do the right thing.
I know that sometimes you have to kill because otherwise we all would be killed. But murder is a sin...
Well... I suppose you could always find someone who's unhappy and give them the option to leave...
No one is judge, jury, and executioner - this is madness! If this is how you intend to run the place, maybe it's time to elect a new leader!
If there is no other business, I believe that concludes our meeting...
